ratings.question_text: Your level of engagement with the course was:
What is your overall assessment of this course?
The course was well organized to facilitate student learning.
I received clear feedback that improved my learning.
Relative to other courses you have taken at Yale, the level of intellectual challenge of this course was:
Relative to other courses you have taken at Yale, the workload of this course was:

narratives.question_text: What knowledge, skills, and insights did you develop by taking this course?
comments: How to engage in stage combat, build fight choreography, analyze movement in theatrical settings.
I learned a lot of physical skills for stage violence. I also think I developed greater awareness of my body and more of an appreciation for theater.
A basic knowledge of stage combat in practice (both hand-to-hand and knife-based!) and in choreography.
I learned a lot about my body, theater, the nuances of violence, and was able to learn tons of practical, real-life experience for use in the theater world! best class ever-- take this course!
A really solid foundation for performing and choreographing hand-to-hand and armed theatrical violence!
I learned a lot about how to keep stage combat safe and professional.
how to choreograph and safely perform hand to hand combat and knife fighting as well as how to make fake blood

narratives.question_text: What are the strengths and weaknesses of this course and how could it be improved?
comments: The course is awesome. It's hands-on and movement-based so every day is interesting. Mike and Kelsey are also always willing and able to speed up or slow down the class which keeps the pace perfect for the group.

I can only think of strengths! Mike and Kelsey are great teachers, class is super interesting and exciting, and almost all of the time needed for the class can take place. during class time. This class was one of the coolest things I've gotten to do here.

Nothing but strengths!! Kelsey and Mike are beyond helpful and work to keep everyone engaged at all times. The work is engaging, interesting, and FUN. Work outside of class is required for midterm and final choreography, but entirely manageable.

Strengths: everything! great class culture, really respectful professors and meaningful assignments with a lot of support.

weaknesses: we ran out of time to do fall day, which the class was really looking forward to!

I thought the way in which each move was explained and integrated into our regular practice really facilitated learning, although I do think it would've been helpful to repeat moves more before moving onto the next so quickly.

narratives.question_text: Would you recommend this course to another student? Please explain.
comments: Yes! It's super fun and still manages to teach you a lot.
Yes! An incredible course utterly different from most others at Yale. It made me think differently, use my body, and I had so much fun with the other students. A great experience.
YES!!!! Yes yes yes yes yes if you can get in- if you want to take a different kind of course that keeps you on your feet at all times. Its an exercise as much for your body as it is for your mind!
YES!

Yes - 100%! For anyone interested in acting stage combat is such a valuable skill and for anyone interested in telling stories (directing producing designing even) the fundamentals of consent based work and critical analysis of the stories you are telling is so important.

I would definitely recommend this course to any actor or director, or anyone with an interest in doing fight choreography. Not only did it give me the confidence to execute and choreograph fights, but I also really appreciated the emphasis on cultivating a consent-based classroom and rehearsal space.
Yes.  This course was incredible, both in the kind and helpful instruction we received and in the fascinating content.  This is a must take for anyone who wants to act.

Yes! This is the perfect class--you learn so much but it's not stressful. Outside of the midterm and final, there's not a lot of work required outside of class. Classes are a joy to attend, and Mike and Kelsey are great at giving clear feedback along the way which makes it easy to learn everything correctly. And if you've ever wanted to punch your professor, this is your chance.
